content: Hello Mister Heine, my name is Bo Li from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in New York. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Bo Li from China

content: Thank you for showing interest in the apartment, Mr. Li. However, I am afraid that I cannot negotiate the rental price with you at the moment. I am currently occupied with other matters and do not have the time to discuss the details of the rental agreement. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
name: Heinrich Heine

content: I am interested in the apartment, but I want to negotiate the rental price. I am willing to pay a fair price for the apartment. Can you give me an offer?
name: Bo Li from China

content: Certainly, Mr. Li. Based on the current market conditions and the location of the apartment, I would like to propose a rental price of 1,500 Euros per month. This price is based on the size of the apartment, the amenities available, and the current demand for rental properties in the area. I believe that this price is fair and competitive, and I am confident that it will attract a suitable tenant. Is this price within your budget?
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
Yes, I can pay that price. I would like to negotiate the rental price. Can you give me a better offer?

I am also willing to pay more if you can give me a better offer.

I am dependable and responsible, so I would like to be on good terms with the landlord.

I am a student, so I don't plan to stay here for a long time. I will be leaving in 1 year.

I am from China, so I don't know much about the rental market in New York. Can you give me some advice on what is a fair rental price for this apartment?

I don't want to pay more than I have to, so I would like to negotiate the rental price.

I would like to know how much you can reduce the rental price before I accept it.
name: Bo Li from China

content:
Thank you for your interest in the apartment, Mr. Li. I understand your concerns and I would be happy to provide you with some guidance on a fair rental price for this property.

Based on my research and the current market conditions, I believe that a rental price of 1,500 Euros per month is a fair and competitive price for this apartment. However, I am open to discussing a lower rental price if that is what you are looking for.

As for your other questions, I appreciate your willingness to be a dependable and responsible tenant. Your status as a student and your plans to leave in a year are also factors that I will take into consideration when negotiating the rental price.

In terms of advice, I would recommend researching the rental market in New York and looking at comparable properties in the area to get a better sense of what a fair rental price might be. You may also want to consider factors such as the location, the size of the apartment, and the amenities available when determining a fair rental price.

Ultimately, my goal is to find a rental price that works for both you and me. If you are willing to negotiate, I am open to discussing a lower rental price. However, I am not willing to accept a rental price that is significantly lower than the market value of the property.

Is there a specific rental price that you are looking for?
name: Heinrich Heine
